eschneider on Mon, 03/14/2022 - 14:14 Mar 14, 2022 AmeriCorps staff Dear Ameri-Family, Across the nation AmeriCorps continues to be a force multiplier bringing diverse individuals and institutions together to tackle some of the nation’s toughest challenges. During these extraordinary times, AmeriCorps members have provided extraordinary service by keeping our kids in school and on track, and helping our communities build back stronger than before. Please join me in continuing to celebrate these accomplishments throughout AmeriCorps Week, as we thank those who serve and support national service across our country and encourage others to follow in their footsteps. I hit the road over the weekend visiting Mississippi and Louisiana and I am looking forward to continuing visiting program sites this week in Alabama, DC, Virginia, and Minnesota to see the power of service in action. Get ready to show off your AmeriCorps gear Thursday on #DayOfTheA and stay tuned for the latest AmeriCorps Week news. Thank you for all your contributions to advance our mission. I am proud to be part of this team and all the work being done in communities around the country. Happy AmeriCorps Week! In Service, Michael AmeriCorps members and volunteers bring hope and opportunity to families and communities that need it most. Join us in celebrating #AmeriCorpsWeek and follow @AmeriCorps as we highlight stories across the country! pic.twitter.com/S2QYOGD4xb — Michael D. Smith (@AmeriCorpsCEO) March 14, 2022 Join the AmeriCorps Week Celebration We loved hearing about what you are planning throughout this week and can't wait to see it in action. Some of you are already featured in the news. Check it out! Senators Manchin and Capito welcomed five AmeriCorps NCCC teams to the Mountain state of West Virginia. These AmeriCorps members will support tax preparation, river and trail revitalization, and more. #AmeriThanks @Sen_JoeManchin & @SenCapito for welcoming 5⃣ @AmeriCorpsNCCC teams to the Mountain State of West Virginia! Together, these @AmeriCorps members will get things done to support tax prep, river + trail revitalization & more ⤵️ https://t.co/Mxsq6DTiHc — AmeriCorps NCCC (@AmeriCorpsNCCC) March 12, 2022 Read more AmeriCorps Week observed March 13-19 - Tullahoma News - March 10, 2022 AmeriCorps Week celebrating people helping tackle country's challenges - Yahoo news - March 10, 2022 Celebrating local heroes serving in AmeriCorps - Bethany Ridgeway – Coleman Today - March 10, 2022 Sens. Manchin, Capito announce five new AmeriCorps projects across West Virginia - WVNews - March 11, 2022 AmeriCorps Week kicks off Sunday, thanking volunteers serving in Weld and Larimer counties - The Denver Gazette - March 12, 2022 UG celebrates AmeriCorps partnership by recognizing AmeriCorps Week - Unified Government of Wyandotte County and Kansas City KS - March 11, 2022 Join Two Social Media Events Day of the A: Thursday, March 17 Show off your AmeriCorps gear – new logo, old logo – it doesn’t matter! Don your favorite tee, break out your old baseball cap, or show off your AmeriCorps-themed arts and crafts project. Take a photo and share it on your personal social media channels in honor of the #DayoftheA. Don't forget to tag @AmeriCorps and use the hashtag #DayoftheA in your posts. #AmeriThanks Thunderclap: Friday, March 18, noon ET End AmeriCorps Week with a bang by saying thank you to all our member and volunteers across the US. Join us on Friday by sharing our #AmeriThanks social media post found in the social press kit from your Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram account. Be sure to use the same graphic, include the hashtags #AmeriCorpsWeek and #AmeriThanks, and tag @AmeriCorps in your post. Need Engagement Ideas? We've got you covered! Share AmeriCorps' Impact. Through op-eds, letters to the editor, social media, or other communications channels, you can highlight the impact of the work members do in your community. Host an “honorary AmeriCorps  member”. Invite media, an elected official, a community leader, school principal, AmeriCorps alumnus, or other local dignitary to see AmeriCorps in action by becoming an “honorary AmeriCorps member” or by doing a site visit. In previous years, we've seen leaders from across the country participate in their local communities. More ideas This AmeriCorps Week join with us as we celebrate the impact of our programs and offer our thanks to members and volunteers for making an impact and serve others. Together, we can help the country recover and come back stronger. Together, we persevere. Together, we are AmeriCorps. Visit our website for more information and follow the digital conversation about AmeriCorps Week on AmeriCorps' Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. Happy AmeriCorps Week!
